Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Meticulous \Me*tic"u*lous\, a. [L. meticulosus, fr. metus fear: cf. F. m['e]ticuleux.] Timid; fearful. [archaic] [1913 Webster]
2. Taking great care to get every detail correct; working thoroughly and with precision; as, meticulous workmanship. [PJC] -- {Me*tic"u*lous*ly}, adv. [1913 Webster]
meticulously adv : in a meticulous manner; "the set was meticulously authentic"
